Test Description: Create volumes (local, remote, mirrored). Attach it to a pod. Allow it to run IO for some time. Create single plex snapshot using kubernetes api. Allow snapshot to move into Available state. Create LCV out of the snapshot using kubernetes api. Check whether they get created successfully

Create a mirrored volume. Attach it to a pod that runs write with specific pattern (diamanti/fio-verify). Allow the pod to complete writing the pattern. Pod will move to Completed state. Delete the pod and run pod that does pattern verification. It should run for sometime and move to Completed state. Now create snapshot of volume using kubernetes api. Allow snapshot to move into Available state. Create LCV out of the snapshot using kubernetes api. Check whether they get created successfully. Run the pattern verification pod on LCV. Pattern verification should be successful.

Create a mirrored volume. Attach it to a pod that runs write with specific pattern (diamanti/fio-verify). Allow the pod to complete writing the pattern. Pod will move to Completed state. Delete the pod and run pod that does pattern verification. It should run for sometime and move to Completed state. Now create snapshot of volume using kubernetes api. Allow snapshot to move into Available state. Create LCV out of the snapshot using kubernetes api. Check whether they get created successfully. Run the pattern verification pod on LCV. Pattern verification should be successful. 
Reboot the node that has the LCV. After the node comes up, run the pattern verification pod on LCV and the original volume. Pod should complete successfully.

Create volumes (local, remote, mirrored). Attach them to pods. Allow them to run IO for some time. Create 16 single plex snapshot of each volume using kubernetes api. Allow snapshots to move into Available state. Create 8 LCVs out of each snapshot using kubernetes api. Check whether they get created successfully. Attach pods to all LCVs
Bug no:
It is not possible to attach all the lcv's to the pod at once 
Verified with random lcv attaching to fio pods

Test Description: Create mirrored volume. Attach it to a pod. Allow it to run for few mins. Shutdown initiator. Pod should move to another node and get attached to another plex. Create snapshot of volume & LCV out of snapshot using kubernetes api. It should get successfully created. Attach pod to LCV. It should start running

Create mirrored volume.  Attach it to a pod that runs write with specific pattern (diamanti/fio-verify). Allow the pod to complete writing the pattern. Pod will move to Completed state. Delete the pod and run pod that does pattern verification. It should run for sometime and move to Completed state. Shutdown 1 target. Create snapshot of volume & LCV out of snapshot using kubernetes api. Power on the target. Allow snapshot to move into Available state. Create LCV out of the snapshot using kubernetes api. Check whether they get created successfully. Run the pattern verification pod on LCV. Pattern verification should be successful.

Create mirrored volume.  Attach it to a pod that runs write with specific pattern (diamanti/fio-verify). Allow the pod to complete writing the pattern. Pod will move to Completed state. Delete the pod and run pod that does pattern verification. It should run for sometime and move to Completed state. Shutdown 2 targets. Create snapshot of volume & LCV out of snapshot using kubernetes api. Power on the target. Allow snapshot to move into Available state. Create LCV out of the snapshot using kubernetes api. Check whether they get created successfully. Run the pattern verification pod on LCV. Pattern verification should be successful.
Bug no: Can't test this on 2 node setup due to cluster split brain scenario when 2 quorum nodes are shutdown

Test Description: Create a mirrored volume. Attach it to a pod that runs write with specific pattern (diamanti/fio-verify). Allow the pod to complete writing the pattern. Pod will move to Completed state. Delete the pod and run pod that does pattern verification. It should run for sometime and move to Completed state. Now create snapshot of volume using kubernetes api. Allow snapshot to move into Available state. Create a storage class with perf tier as high or medium. Create LCV out of the snapshot using kubernetes api and use the new storage class. Check whether they get created successfully and LCV has perf tier as high / medium. Run the pattern verification pod on LCV. Pattern verification should be successful.
Bug no:
- apiVersion: storage.k8s.io/v1
 kind: StorageClass
 metadata:
   name: snapshot-promoter-high
 parameters:
   driver: diamanti.com/volume
   perfTier: high
 provisioner: volumesnapshot.external-storage.k8s.io/snapshot-promoter

Test Description: Use the backup job spec to perform backup using S3 agent from LCV to cloud
Deleting VolumeSnapshot should also delete VolumeSnapshotData object
Delete VolumeSnapshotData object while it's VolumeSnapshot is in use. Should  succeed. But lcv & snapshot should not delete.
Delete VolumeSnapshot when a LCV (restored volume) created from it, is still being used. Should  succeed. But snapshot & lcv should not be deleted
Add plex to restored volume (LCV). Should fail
Create snapshot from restored volume. Should not fail.
